name: Beretta M1935
description: The Beretta M1935 is an M1934 modified to fire .32 ACP instead of .380. Like the M1934 it was issued to Axis forces in WWII and was captured by the Allies. It also continued to be produced after the war for civilian markets.

name: Beretta 70
description: The Beretta 70 is a compact pistol that improved upon and modernized the earlier M1934/5 and can be found in many different calibers and barrel sizes. This is the base .32 ACP model, also known as the Puma.

name: Beretta 70 S
description: The Beretta 70 S is a Model 70 with some minor changes and improvements, offered in .22LR, .32 ACP and .380 ACP. This one is in .32 ACP.

name: Beretta 100
description: The Beretta 100 is essentially a .22LR Model 74 chambered in .32 ACP, featuring the 74's 150mm barrel and style of grips but is otherwise the same. It also features a larger 9-round magazine, as opposed to the .32 ACP 70 S with an 8-round magazine.

name: Beretta 81
description: The Beretta Cheetah 81 is a compact pistol chambered for the .32 ACP cartridge. The 81 features a 12-round double stack magazine, unlike the 82 which is thinner with a single stack 9-round magazine.

name: Beretta 82
description: The Beretta Cheetah 82 is a compact pistol chambered for the .32 ACP cartridge. The 82 features a single stack 9-round magazine and is thinner than the 81 with a 12-round double stack magazine.

name: Beretta Tomcat
description: The Beretta Tomcat is a tiny gun chambered in the .32 ACP cartridge and was designed for concealed carry and home defense. Interestingly, it has a tip-up barrel like some older Beretta pistols, meaning you load the first round directly into the chamber instead of racking the slide to chamber it.
